content.p: To contribute to the Resolver project one needs to fork the repository. This repository is located at Github.
Did you find a bug? Please submit a pull request. To submit a pull request we follow a strict guideline.
If you do not have a fork yet, fork the repository and add a remote to the repository:

p.code: git clone git@github.com:<Your Username>/resolver.git cd resolver git remote add upstream git@github.com:pixelpolishers/resolver.git
git checkout master git pull upstream master git push origin

content.p: Now create a branch, you will be doing your changes in there:

Adding new features is much appreciated. Please submit a pull request in order for your feature request to be evaluated.
This works pretty much the same as fixing bugs. First of all you need the repository:

p.code: git clone git@github.com:<Your Username>/resolver.git cd resolver git remote add upstream git@github.com:pixelpolishers/resolver.git

content.p: Next pull the latest changes. All new features should be based on the latest development branch which is called "develop".

p.code: git checkout develop git pull upstream develop git push origin
